results.title: Brief city: the story of London's festival buildings
results.creator_credit: Massingham Productions, Richard Massingham, Maurice Harvey and Jacques Brunius
results.brief_description: A tour of inspection of the Festival of Britain South Bank Exhibition photographed during the last ten days of the Exhibition. Emphasis is placed on the architecture of the Exhibition, explaining why it was planned as a “giant toyshop”, why it was given no processional vista, and how the Exhibition was regarded as an experiment in modern building and architecture.
results.title_for_label: Brief city: the story of London’s festival buildings
results.creator_credit_for_label: Massingham Productions, Richard Massingham, Maurice Harvey and Jacques Brunius

results.title: Bridgit
results.brief_description: The 32 minute work by Scottish artist Charlotte Prodger won the 2018 Turner Prize, and explores themes of class, gender, sexuality and neolithic goddesses.

constellations_other.name: A handheld aesthetic
constellations_other.description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.

results.title: Bridging the learning gap
results.creator_credit: University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre and George Pashuk
results.brief_description: Discusses the use of small discussion groups as the main teaching medium in the University’s Faculty of Law, and reasons for the adoption of the system. The role of the teacher in this teaching situation, and the extent to which objectives are being achieved are being evaluated by the T.E.R.C. Increasing student interest and involvement is apparent.

results.title: Bridging the highways
results.creator_credit: Dorman Long & Co and John Byrd
results.brief_description: Steel bridges put together on site from prefabricated universal sections mean a saving in labour and greater speed in bridge constructions. The sections are despatched ready for erection to numerous sites all over modern motorway Britain.

results.title: Bridging the gap: the many worlds of Mandawuy (A)
results.creator_credit: Kevin Ryder, John Walsh and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face the press”.
Paolo Totaro hosts a discussion between Rhoda Roberts (Vox Populi), Sonia Voumard (The Age) and Mandawauy Yunupingu (teacher, musican, ambassador and father), on the eve of National Aborigines Day. Mandawuy explores the ways he is bridging the gap between black and white culture through both his band Yothu Yindi, the first aboriginal band to make the charts and to sign with an American record company; and as the Principal of the Yirrkala Community School in North East Arnhem Land, where, as the first aboriginal headmaster, he devised the curriculum mix of aboriginal and western studies known as “Both Ways Education”.
results.title_for_label: Bridging the gap: the many worlds of Mandawuy (A)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kevin Ryder, John Walsh and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service

results.title: Bridging the gap
results.brief_description: Designed to help acquire and realise the vital skills of parent-child communications. Dr Thomas Gordon, a nationally recognised authority, discusses such needs as identity, honest recognition of feelings, and courageous action as new methods of communicating, in an attempt to establish a deeper, and more intimate, relationship between parent and child.

results.title: Bridging the centuries
results.creator_credit: Royal Doulton, World Wide and John Patterson Reid
results.brief_description: Traces the history of pottery making in Britain from neolithic times to the present day. Examples of rare English pottery and china from different centuries are shown. Illustrates the influence of Chinese work on the development of English bone china. Describes the evolution of English translucent china particularly for tableware.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Royal Doulton, World Wide and John Patterson Reid

results.title: Bridget Riley
results.creator_credit: Balfour Films, Arts Council of Great Britain and David Thompson
results.brief_description: A profile of artist, Bridget Riley. Explores the inspirations she draws from the visual experiences in nature and follows her into her studio where she organises and activates her paintings. Credits include A.A. Englander (photographer) and Roy Ayton (editor).
